DataElement.preferredName: Castration-Resistant Prostate Carcinoma Intervention or Procedure Assessment Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The coded response to determine patient eligibility for clinical trial participation related to the assessments of activities that produce an effect, or that is intended to alter the course of CRPR as outlined in the protocol.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Castration-Resistant Prostate Carcinoma Intervention or Procedure Assessment Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Prostate carcinoma that grows and continues to spread despite the surgical removal of the testes or medical intervention to block androgen production._An activity that produces an effect, or that is intended to alter the course of a disease in a patient or population. This is a general term that encompasses the medical, social, behavioral, and environmental acts that can have preventive, therapeutic, or palliative effects._The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of._Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Prostate carcinoma that grows and continues to spread despite the surgical removal of the testes or medical intervention to block androgen production.

Concepts.definition: Prostate carcinoma that grows and continues to spread despite the surgical removal of the testes or medical intervention to block androgen production.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: Has castration resistance bee
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has castration resistance been documented with surgical or medical castration with serum testosterone less than 50ng/dL (less than 2.0 nM)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have castrate level of testosterone (less than 50ng/dL)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have histologically or cytologically confirmed adenocarcinoma of the prostate that is castration-resistant, defined as: serum testosterone level less than or equal to 50 ng/dL or 1.7 nmol/L, bilateral orchiectomy or receiving maintenance androgen ablation therapy with luteinizing hormone-releasing hormone (LHRH) or antiandrogen such as bicalutamide, or has a serum PSA progression defined as two consecutive increases in PSA over a previous reference value, at least one week apart?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have castrate-range testosterone (less than 50 ng/dL) after androgen deprivation therapy (ADT) or orchiectomy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient is receiving standard of care androgen deprivation treatment (surgical castration versus LHRH agonist or antagonist treatment), is patient eligible to participate in the trial?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CCTG_01
ReferenceDocuments.description: Participant has evidence of castrate resistance (defined as a rising PSA > 3.0 ng/ml while testosterone is < 3.0 nmol/l).

DataElement.administrativeNotes: 11/17/23 Added AQT and alt OID for CCTG ticket number CADSR0003085 cjl; 5/4/23 added AQT LS
